title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel set in the 1930s, exploring racial injustice and moral growth through the eyes of a young girl in Alabama.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel portraying a totalitarian society where Big Brother watches everyone, and individualism is brutally suppressed.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic romantic novel revolving around the Bennett sisters, their pursuit of love, and the societal norms of 19th-century England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: Set in the 1920s, this novel depicts the American Dream, wealth, and the tragic love story of Jay Gatsby and Daisy Buchanan.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A tale of Captain Ahab's obsession with hunting down the white whale, Moby-Dick, as it explores themes of obsession and the nature of evil.

title: To the Lighthouse
author: Virginia Woolf
description: A stream-of-consciousness novel that delves into the complex relationships and thoughts of the Ramsay family during their visits to a lighthouse.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel narrated by Holden Caulfield, a disenchanted teenager struggling with the phoniness of society.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic novel where humans are genetically engineered and socially conditioned to maintain stability and pleasure in a controlled society.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bronte
description: A bildungsroman following Jane Eyre's journey from her difficult childhood to becoming a governess and her passionate love for Mr. Rochester.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A prelude to The Lord of the Rings, following Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on an adventure with a group of dwarves to reclaim their homeland.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic poem that recounts the hero Odysseus' journey home after the Trojan War, encountering mythical creatures and challenges.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A spiritual allegorical novel about Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy, who embarks on a quest to find a hidden treasure.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: Set in 19th-century St. Petersburg, this psychological novel explores the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of Rodion Raskolnikov, a poor ex-student.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel depicting the moral corruption of Dorian Gray, who remains eternally youthful while a portrait of him ages and reflects his sins.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description: A multi-generational family saga blending fantasy and reality, exploring the history of the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: A series of fantasy novels following the adventures of children who enter the magical world of Narnia through a wardrobe.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Bronte
description: A dark tale of love and revenge on the Yorkshire moors, centered around the passionate and tumultuous relationship between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: Set during the Great Depression, this novel tells the story of the Joad family's journey from Oklahoma to California in search of a better life.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A Russian classic exploring themes of love, infidelity, and societal norms through the tragic tale of Anna Karenina and Count Vronsky.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem divided into three parts—Inferno, Purgatorio, and Paradiso—depicting the journey of Dante through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A Gothic novel exploring the consequences of scientific ambition and the moral responsibility of creation, as Victor Frankenstein brings a creature to life.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A bildungsroman and sequel to The Adventures of Tom Sawyer, following Huck Finn and Jim, an escaped slave, as they journey along the Mississippi River.

title: Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
description: A psychological novel following a group of boys stranded on an uninhabited island, exploring the dark depths of human nature and civilization.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's turbulent history, following Amir and Hassan.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
description: An anti-war novel blending elements of science fiction, following Billy Pilgrim as he becomes unstuck in time and experiences the horrors of World War II.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: Set in 17th-century Puritan Boston, this novel follows Hester Prynne, who wears a scarlet letter 'A' as a mark of her adultery, exploring themes of sin, guilt, and redemption.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic poem that depicts the Trojan War and the wrath of Achilles, exploring the themes of honor, glory, and the futility of war.
